com.revature.banking.dao.postgres

Class UserDaoPostgres

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.revature.banking.dao.postgres.UserDaoPostgres
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    UserDao

    public class UserDaoPostgres
extends java.lang.Object
implements UserDao
    This is the implementation for UserDao to interact with my PostgreSQL database.
    Author:
    Jared F Bennatt

      • createNewUserAndAccount

        public boolean createNewUserAndAccount(EncryptedUser eUser,
                                       EncryptedBankAccount eba)
        Description copied from interface: UserDao
        This creates a new user in the database and creates (and links) the given bank account to their user account.
        Specified by:
        createNewUserAndAccount in interface UserDao
        Parameters:
        eUser - The user record to be created (should contain, at least the first name, last name, tax id, user name, and password).
        eba - Bank Account information to be added to the database.
        Returns:
        Wether or not this action was successful.

      • updateUserCreateNewAccount

        public boolean updateUserCreateNewAccount(EncryptedUser eUser,
                                          EncryptedBankAccount eba)
        Description copied from interface: UserDao
        This is intended to be used when a User already exists but has no open accounts. This method will update the user's record (which means eUser must contain a valid user_key) and create a new bank account for them.
        Specified by:
        updateUserCreateNewAccount in interface UserDao
        Parameters:
        eUser - The user record to be updated (should contain every field: user_key, first name, last name, tax id, user name, and password).
        eba - The new account to be added and linked to this user.
        Returns:
        Whether or not this was successful.

      • deleteUser

        public boolean deleteUser(EncryptedUser eUser)
        Description copied from interface: UserDao
        Completely deletes user from the system. This deletes the record from the database.
        Specified by:
        deleteUser in interface UserDao
        Parameters:
        eUser - User to be deleted. This needs to have, at least, the user_key set.
        Returns:
        Whether or not this action was successful.
        See Also:
        UserDao.removeUser(EncryptedUser)

      • removeUser

        public boolean removeUser(EncryptedUser eUser)
        Description copied from interface: UserDao
        This removes the user from the system. This does not remove the user's record, it only invalidates their login (by deleting the username and password).
        Specified by:
        removeUser in interface UserDao
        Parameters:
        eUser - User to be removed. This needs to have, at least, the user_key set.
        Returns:
        Whether or not this action was successful.
        See Also:
        UserDao.deleteUser(EncryptedUser)

      • getUserByUserName

        public EncryptedUser getUserByUserName(java.lang.String username)
        Description copied from interface: UserDao
        Retrieves the information for this user from their username (which should be unique). The returned user needs to set (at least) the user_key and the password (so that it can be checked). The other fields are not necessary.
        Specified by:
        getUserByUserName in interface UserDao
        Parameters:
        username - Unique username of user trying to log in.
        Returns:
        An EncryptedUser object of the found record or null if no such record exists.

      • createNewUser

        public boolean createNewUser(EncryptedUser eUser)
        Description copied from interface: UserDao
        This creates a new user in the database. This does not create or link an account.
        Specified by:
        createNewUser in interface UserDao
        Parameters:
        eUser - User crendentials to be added.
        Returns:
        Whether or not this was succesful.

      • updateUser

        public boolean updateUser(EncryptedUser eUser)
        Description copied from interface: UserDao
        Updates a user that should already exist in the database. The user's user_key must be set for this to work. This method will attempt to update everything held in eUser (it does not check for consistency in terms of the tax id or names not changing).
        Specified by:
        updateUser in interface UserDao
        Parameters:
        eUser - The user to be updated.
        Returns:
        Whether or not this was successful.
